TEXT.TITLE: PAKISTAN REPORTEDLY BOUGHT WHITE SUGAR AT TENDER
TEXT.BODY: Pakistan is reported to have bought 100,000 tonnes of white sugar at its weekend tender from a North Korean operator, traders said. The purchase, believed priced around 210 dlrs a tonne cost and freight for fine/medium grain, was due to be shipped for arrival in May (30,000 tonnes), in June (45,000) and in July (25,000 tonnes), they said. Reuter
